title: Tetsu Kasuya 4:6 Method (Original)
preparation_steps: Grind 20 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency.
Add 20g coffee and level the bed.

brewing_steps.instruction: Start with 60 grams of water to wet the coffee and begin extraction.
brewing_steps.audio_script: First pour: Add 60g of water steadily over the grounds. This step begins extraction and sets sweetness and acidity balance.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add 60 grams more water, pouring evenly to shape flavor balance.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Second pour: Add another 60g of water evenly across the bed. This continues balancing sweetness with acidity.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 60 grams steadily. This step begins to define body and clarity.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Third pour: Add 60g water with a controlled, steady stream. This influences the cup's body and clarity.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add 60 grams more water, keeping the pour steady and even.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Fourth pour: Add 60g water evenly. Maintain consistency for balanced extraction and structure.

brewing_steps.instruction: Finish with the last 60 grams of water. Let it flow through naturally.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Final pour: Add the last 60g of water gently. Let the bed settle and extraction complete naturally.

brewing_steps.instruction: Let the coffee drain on its own. The brew ends around three and a half minutes.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Allow the coffee to drain fully. The brew should finish in about 3.5 minutes with a clean, balanced cup.
